knimeNode.name: CaseControlAnalyzer
knimeNode.shortDescription: Identification of significant genes in case control studies.

fullDescription.intro: This node enables the identification of genes that are significantly more often affected by (LOF) variants in the case group than in the control group of a study. Different methods can be applied to evaluate the significance of a gene. The node requires a gene summary of the LOFSummary node as input. A genetic background file (created by the GeneticBackgroundModel node) can be given to enhance the statistical power of the analysis.
fullDescription.option: Set the field headers, if the gene summary is generated by another node than the LOFSummary.
Set the model file headers, if it is generated by another node than the GeneticBackgroundModel. Set a pseudo frequency for genes that have not been observed to carry any (LOF) variants.

Select the statistics to be computed and choose the p-values by which the resulting file is ordered. The p-values are corrected for multiple comparison using the method of Benjamini-Hochberg (FDR). The adjusted p-values are given in an extra column in the extended gene summary.

ports.inPort: Cell 0: Gene summary file containing a contingency table for each gene.
Cell 0: Genetic background model comprising the variant frequencies for each gene.
ports.outPort: Input gene summary extended by the computed and adjusted p-values ordered by the chosen statistic.
